greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Factorial expansion of sqrt(Pi) = Sum_{n>0} a(n)/n!.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[If[n == 1, Floor[Sqrt[Pi]], Floor[n!*Sqrt[Pi]] - n*Floor[(n - 1)!*Sqrt[Pi]]], {n, 1, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 21 2018 *)
program: (PARI) default(realprecision, 250); for(n=1,30, print1(if(n==1, floor(sqrt(Pi)), floor(n!*sqrt(Pi)) - n*floor((n-1)!*sqrt(Pi))), ", ")) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 21 2018

(MAGMA) SetDefaultRealField(RealField(250));  R:= RealField(); [Floor(Sqrt(Pi(R)))] cat [Floor(Factorial(n)*Sqrt(Pi(R))) - n*Floor(Factorial((n-1))*Sqrt(Pi(R))) : n in [2..30]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 21 2018
[A068450(n) for n in (1..80)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 27 2018
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Mar 10 2002
